alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Jackson; Mason; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:47AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Meigs, northeastern Gallia, central Calhoun, northeastern Mason, southwestern Wirt, northwestern Roane and Jackson Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 246 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mason to 7 miles south of Elizabeth. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Spencer, Pomeroy, Racine, Ravenswood, New Haven, Mason, Sandyville, Arnoldsburg, Middleport, Syracuse, Hartford City, Reedy, Cheshire, Millstone, Portland, Statts Mills, Lakin, Given and Cottageville. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 129 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
